reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Supporting Transformative Resilience in Area C East Jerusalem and Gaza
Transformatiivisen Resilienssin tukiohjelma C-alueella Ita-Jerusalemissa ja Gazassa

description.narrative: More than 50 years of Israeli occupation have caused regional fragmentation and separated Palestinian communities from each other. This fragmentation and lack of Palestinian sovereignty in Area C Gaza and East Jerusalem have led to a particularly precariou s and continuing vulnerability that characterizes the daily lives of these communities. As a result there are growing development gaps in Palestine and trust between the Palestinian people and the government is undermined without a clear political and econ omic vision.At the same time the challenges brought by Covid-19 are plaguing Palestine's already weak economy and raising poverty and unemployment rates as well as further complicating the lives of the most vulnerable communities especially women and youth .The long-term aim of the Supporting Transformative Resilience in Area C East Jerusalem and Gaza program (Transformative Resilience Program TRP) is to promote resilience of Palestinians in the most vulnerable circumstances. The immediate objectives of the program are: 1. to improve access to services and economic opportunities in Area C East Jerusalem and Gaza especially for women and youth; 2. to strengthen political cultural economic and social cohesion and improve the inclusion of vulnerable groups in pa rticular women and youth; and 3. to support institutional and behavioral change to reduce socio-economic inequalities including gender inequality.The program is in line with Finland's country strategy and supports the country program (2021 - 2024) by stren gthening the resilience of Palestinians in the most vulnerable circumstances.The program is managed by UNDP and the total budget for 2021-2024 is 40 MUSD. Finland supports the program with 3 MEURO in 2021-2024.

More than 50 years of Israeli occupation have caused regional fragmentation and separated Palestinian communities from each other. This fragmentation and lack of Palestinian sovereignty in Area C Gaza and East Jerusalem have led to a particularly precariou s and continuing vulnerability that characterizes the daily lives of these communities. As a result there are growing development gaps in Palestine and trust between the Palestinian people and the government is undermined without a clear political and econ omic vision.At the same time the challenges brought by Covid-19 are plaguing Palestine's already weak economy and raising poverty and unemployment rates as well as further complicating the lives of the most vulnerable communities especially women and youth .The long-term aim of the Supporting Transformative Resilience in Area C East Jerusalem and Gaza program (Transformative Resilience Program TRP) is to promote resilience of Palestinians in the most vulnerable circumstances. The immediate objectives of the program are: 1. to improve access to services and economic opportunities in Area C East Jerusalem and Gaza especially for women and youth; 2. to strengthen political cultural economic and social cohesion and improve the inclusion of vulnerable groups in pa rticular women and youth; and 3. to support institutional and behavioral change to reduce socio-economic inequalities including gender inequality.The program is in line with Finland's country strategy and supports the country program (2021 - 2024) by stren gthening the resilience of Palestinians in the most vulnerable circumstances.The program is managed by UNDP and the total budget for 2021-2024 is 40 MUSD. Finland supports the program with 3 MEURO in 2021-2024.

tag.narrative: Generating jobs, livelihood opportunities and well-being in a developing country is a secondary priority area in this activity
